text: Raymond Mathewson Hood (March 29, 1881 â€“ August 14, 1934) was an American architect. He worked in the Neo-Gothic and Art Deco styles. He is best known for his designs of the Tribune Tower, American Radiator Building, and Rockefeller Center. He was born in Pawtucket, Rhode Island. Hood died on August 14, 1934 in Stamford, Connecticut at the age of 53. ==References== Category:1881 births Category:1934 deaths Category:American architects Category:People from Pawtucket, Rhode Island
title: Raymond Hood
